meanings.definition: The quality or state of being prim or excessively proper.
meanings.sent1: Her primnesses in dressing always stood out at the casual office.
meanings.sent2: The primnesses of the Victorian era are evident in the elaborate etiquette.
meanings.sent3: Despite her primnesses, she couldn't resist dancing to the lively music.
meanings.sent4: The garden's primnesses resembled a perfectly arranged painting.
meanings.sent5: The primnesses of the old librarian made the library feel like a time capsule.

meanings.definition: The behavior or attitude of being overly formal or precise.
meanings.sent1: His primnesses in speech made him seem out of touch with modern language.
meanings.sent2: The primnesses of the royal family were evident in their strict protocols.
meanings.sent3: The cat's primnesses in grooming itself were comically exaggerated.
meanings.sent4: The city's primnesses in urban planning created a neat and orderly environment.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's primnesses in grading were known to all the students.
